cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to slow and turn northwest and eventually northeast toward the Florida Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeastern Gulf of Mexico, Florida Keys, Florida peninsula and Big Bend, then the southeastern U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts likely to stay below 35 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Plaquemines given track well east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated showers; significant accumulations not expected.
